The dozens of chemicals found in the bodies of pregnant Americans is explored in <a href="../video/%EF%BB%BFcdc-report-on-environmental-chemical-exposure/" rel="nofollow">CDC Report on Environmental Chemical Exposure</a>. For more on which foods appear most contaminated, see yesterday’s <a href="../" rel="nofollow">NutritionFacts.org</a> video-of-the-day <a href="../video/food-sources-of-flame-retardant-chemicals/" rel="nofollow">Food Sources of Flame Retardant Chemicals</a>. I have <a href="../topics/pregnancy/" rel="nofollow">30 other videos</a> on eating for healthy pregnancies, including <a href="../video/dangerous-advice-from-health-food-store-employees/" rel="nofollow">Dangerous Advice From Health Food Store Employees</a>, <a href="../video/preventing-childhood-allergies/" rel="nofollow">Preventing Childhood Allergies</a>, and <a href="../video/pregnant-vegans-at-risk-for-iodine-deficiency-2/" rel="nofollow">Pregnant Vegans at Risk for Iodine Deficiency</a>. Even if we do pass a load of pollutants onto our babies, how long does it take their bodies to get rid of them? That’s covered tomorrow in <a href="../video/how-fast-can-children-detoxify-from-pcbs/" rel="nofollow">How Fast Can Children Detoxify from PCBs?</a></p><p>For some context, please check out my associated blog posts: <a href=" http://nutritionfacts.org/2013/03/21/protecting-our-babies-from-pollutants/"> Protecting Our Babies From Pollutants</a>, <a href="http://nutritionfacts.org/2013/06/25/apple-peels-turn-on-anticancer-genes/">Apple Peels Turn On Anticancer Genes</a>, and <a href="http://nutritionfacts.org/2013/07/23/meat-fumes-dietary-secondhand-smoke/">Heading Shrinking from Grilling Meat</a></p><p>If you haven't yet, you can subscribe to my videos for free by <a href="http://nutritionfacts.us5.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=c1bae6687e1e6ab175fb56913&id=40f9e497d1" rel="nofollow">clicking here</a>.</p></div><div class="small-12 columns"> <a href="http://nutritionfacts.org/faq/#sources-cited" title="Comment Etiquette" target="_blank" class="left"><i class="fa fa-question-circle"></i> Comment Etiquette</a></div><div id="disqus_thread"><div id="dsq-content"><ul id="dsq-comments"><li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="dsq-comment-28238"><div id="dsq-comment-header-28238" class="dsq-comment-header"> <cite id="dsq-cite-28238"> http://nutritionfacts.org/ <span id="dsq-author-user-28238">Michael Greger M.D.</span> </cite></div><div id="dsq-comment-body-28238" class="dsq-comment-body"><div id="dsq-comment-message-28238" class="dsq-comment-message"><p>The reference to pollutants in mothers’ fat is from Friday’s NutritionFacts.org video-of-the-day <a href="http://nutritionfacts.org/video/pollutants-in-californian-breast-tissue" onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'outbound-comment-int', 'http://nutritionfacts.org/video/pollutants-in-californian-breast-tissue', 'Pollutants in Californian Breast Tissue']);"   rel="nofollow">Pollutants in Californian Breast Tissue</a>. The dozens of chemicals found in the bodies of pregnant Americans is explored in <a href="http://nutritionfacts.org/video/﻿cdc-report-on-environmental-chemical-exposure/" onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'outbound-comment-int', 'http://nutritionfacts.org/video/﻿cdc-report-on-environmental-chemical-exposure/', 'CDC Report on Environmental Chemical Exposure']);"   rel="nofollow">CDC Report on Environmental Chemical Exposure</a>. For more on which foods appear most contaminated, see yesterday’s NutritionFacts.org video-of-the-day <a href="http://nutritionfacts.org/video/food-sources-of-flame-retardant-chemicals/" onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'outbound-comment-int', 'http://nutritionfacts.org/video/food-sources-of-flame-retardant-chemicals/', 'Food Sources of Flame Retardant Chemicals']);"   rel="nofollow">Food Sources of Flame Retardant Chemicals</a>. I have <a href="http://nutritionfacts.org/topics/pregnancy/" onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'outbound-comment-int', 'http://nutritionfacts.org/topics/pregnancy/', '30 other videos']);"   rel="nofollow">30 other videos</a> on eating for healthy pregnancies, including <a href="http://nutritionfacts.org/video/dangerous-advice-from-health-food-store-employees/" onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'outbound-comment-int', 'http://nutritionfacts.org/video/dangerous-advice-from-health-food-store-employees/', 'Dangerous Advice From Health Food Store Employees']);"   rel="nofollow">Dangerous Advice From Health Food Store Employees</a>, <a href="http://nutritionfacts.org/video/preventing-childhood-allergies/" onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'outbound-comment-int', 'http://nutritionfacts.org/video/preventing-childhood-allergies/', 'Preventing Childhood Allergies']);"   rel="nofollow">Preventing Childhood Allergies</a>, and <a href="http://nutritionfacts.org/video/pregnant-vegans-at-risk-for-iodine-deficiency-2/" onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'outbound-comment-int', 'http://nutritionfacts.org/video/pregnant-vegans-at-risk-for-iodine-deficiency-2/', 'Pregnant Vegans at Risk for Iodine Deficiency']);"   rel="nofollow">Pregnant Vegans at Risk for Iodine Deficiency</a>. Even if we do pass a load of pollutants onto our babies, how long does it take their bodies to get rid of them? That’s covered tomorrow in <a href="http://nutritionfacts.org/video/how-fast-can-children-detoxify-from-pcbs/" onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'outbound-comment-int', 'http://nutritionfacts.org/video/how-fast-can-children-detoxify-from-pcbs/', 'How Fast Can Children Detoxify from PCBs?']);"   rel="nofollow">How Fast Can Children Detoxify from PCBs?</a><br />  <br /> If you haven’t yet, you can subscribe to my videos for free by <a href="http://nutritionfacts.us5.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=c1bae6687e1e6ab175fb56913&id=40f9e497d1" onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'outbound-comment', 'http://nutritionfacts.us5.list-manage.com/subscribe?u=c1bae6687e1e6ab175fb56913&id=40f9e497d1', 'clicking here']);"   rel="nofollow">clicking here</a>.</p></div></div><ul class="children"><li class="comment odd alt depth-2" id="dsq-comment-28331"><div id="dsq-comment-header-28331" class="dsq-comment-header"> <cite id="dsq-cite-28331"> <span id="dsq-author-user-28331">DT</span> </cite></div><div id="dsq-comment-body-28331" class="dsq-comment-body"><div id="dsq-comment-message-28331" class="dsq-comment-message"><p>Dr Greger, why didn’t you mention the following finding of this study “Vegetable consumption was also associated with lindane and fruit intake with endosulfan I.”?</p></div></div><ul class="children"><li class="comment even depth-3" id="dsq-comment-28721"><div id="dsq-comment-header-28721" class="dsq-comment-header"> <cite id="dsq-cite-28721"> http://www.DonForresterMD.com/ <span id="dsq-author-user-28721">Don Forrester MD</span> </cite></div><div id="dsq-comment-body-28721" class="dsq-comment-body"><div id="dsq-comment-message-28721" class="dsq-comment-message"><p>Consumption of vegetables can lead to ingestion of pesticides and other chemicals if the vegetables are not washed. See the nice post by R Ian Flett to help explain why you don’t find the fat soluble persistent organic pollutants inside plants. They transport material primarily by water whereas our blood stream has fats and is capable of transporting fat soluble substances to our fat cells. Looking at the big picture the consumption of an all plant diet eliminates greater then 95% of pollutants.. buying organic minimizes your exposure further and avoids GMO exposure as well. The latter subject is particularly worrisome due to lack of human studies, complexity of the issue, corporate interests, etc.. For more information on avoiding the latter you can go to <a href="http://www.nongmoshoppingguide.com/" onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'outbound-comment', 'http://www.nongmoshoppingguide.com/', 'http://www.nongmoshoppingguide.com/']);"   rel="nofollow">http://www.nongmoshoppingguide.com/</a>. Next Tuesday we in California have the opportunity to require labeling which will allow consumers to more easily avoid GMO foods. Jeffery Smiths organization, Institute for Responsible Technology, has produced a 1 1/2 hour movie, Genetic Roulette, which is available for free watching through November 6 follow link on website, <a href="http://www.responsibletechnology.org/" onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'outbound-comment', 'http://www.responsibletechnology.org/', 'http://www.responsibletechnology.org/']);"   rel="nofollow">http://www.responsibletechnology.org/</a>. I’m not a fan of studies which use the term “Mediterranean Diet” since the diets consumed by folks who live around the Mediterranean Sea are varied.</p></div></div></li></ul></li></ul></li><li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="dsq-comment-28266"><div id="dsq-comment-header-28266" class="dsq-comment-header"> <cite id="dsq-cite-28266"> <span id="dsq-author-user-28266">HemoDynamic, M.D.</span> </cite></div><div id="dsq-comment-body-28266" class="dsq-comment-body"><div id="dsq-comment-message-28266" class="dsq-comment-message"><p>You down with DDT, yeah you know me.<br /> You down with DDT, yeah you mommy.<br /> You down with DDT, yeah you homie.</p><p>Who’s down with DDT, every last baby!</p><p>Sad but True.</p></div></div></li><li class="comment even thread-even depth-1" id="dsq-comment-28267"><div id="dsq-comment-header-28267" class="dsq-comment-header"> <cite id="dsq-cite-28267"> http://nutrientuniverse.blogspot.co.uk/ <span id="dsq-author-user-28267">JamesKB</span> </cite></div><div id="dsq-comment-body-28267" class="dsq-comment-body"><div id="dsq-comment-message-28267" class="dsq-comment-message"><p>Nothing to do with this video, but could you ask your web designer to add a “play random video button”? That would be cool :D.</p></div></div></li><li class="comment odd alt thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="dsq-comment-28294"><div id="dsq-comment-header-28294" class="dsq-comment-header"> <cite id="dsq-cite-28294"> <span id="dsq-author-user-28294">Thea</span> </cite></div><div id="dsq-comment-body-28294" class="dsq-comment-body"><div id="dsq-comment-message-28294" class="dsq-comment-message"><p>The video says that these chemicals accumulate in fat.  I wonder if the researchers looked at a link between nut consumption and DDTs in the blood since nuts are high in fat. </p><p>Not that I would stop eating nuts.  I’m just curious how much of the DDTs are in nuts vs the animal foods.  Partly I’m thinking about another Dr. Greger video (which I wish I could find again – anyone?) that I believe talked about these chemicals getting more concentrated the higher you move up the food chain.  Based on that, I would guess ahead of time that nuts would not be as affected as meat, fish and dairy.  Just a guess.</p></div></div><ul class="children"><li class="comment even depth-2" id="dsq-comment-28325"><div id="dsq-comment-header-28325" class="dsq-comment-header"> <cite id="dsq-cite-28325"> <span id="dsq-author-user-28325">R Ian Flett</span> </cite></div><div id="dsq-comment-body-28325" class="dsq-comment-body"><div id="dsq-comment-message-28325" class="dsq-comment-message"><p>You raise a very good point. How do vegetable fats compare with animal fats in regard to toxin accumulation in general? The veggie fats are usually encased in a protective shell (nuts, avocados, legumes) so that toxins enter via the roots, whereas leaves can absorb them more directly. Animal fat is efficient at storing toxins, which is why it’s correlated with many cancers.<br /> When we burn off fat it’s like boiling off steam. We are left with higher concentrates of residues. It’s often said that rapid weight loss overloads the bloodstream with toxins stored in the fat and can trigger cancer. It’s better to lose fat slowly and let the body detox at a rate it can cope with.</p></div></div></li></ul></li><li class="comment odd alt thread-even depth-1" id="dsq-comment-28307"><div id="dsq-comment-header-28307" class="dsq-comment-header"> <cite id="dsq-cite-28307"> http://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=561366801 <span id="dsq-author-user-28307">Alfred Tow</span> </cite></div><div id="dsq-comment-body-28307" class="dsq-comment-body"><div id="dsq-comment-message-28307" class="dsq-comment-message"><p>Reminds me of the documentary “Homo toxicus”.<br /> <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M3w8bgaQpSE" onclick="_gaq.push(['_trackEvent', 'outbound-comment', 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M3w8bgaQpSE', 'https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M3w8bgaQpSE']);"   rel="nofollow">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=M3w8bgaQpSE</a></p></div></div></li><li class="comment even thread-odd thread-alt depth-1" id="dsq-comment-28327"><div id="dsq-comment-header-28327" class="dsq-comment-header"> <cite id="dsq-cite-28327"> <span id="dsq-author-user-28327">David Paradine</span> </cite></div><div id="dsq-comment-body-28327" class="dsq-comment-body"><div id="dsq-comment-message-28327" class="dsq-comment-message"><p>Could you post a link to your video regarding cleaning and getting chemicals off vegetables? I know I saw a title regarding this but I’m having no lick finding it. Thanks a lot for all your work.</p></div></div></li></ul></div></div><script type="text/javascript">
